00164 /* Whole sequences space range and zero range definitions */
00165 extern const struct lu_seq_range LUSTRE_SEQ_SPACE_RANGE;
00166 extern const struct lu_seq_range LUSTRE_SEQ_ZERO_RANGE;
00167 extern const struct lu_fid LUSTRE_BFL_FID;
00168 extern const struct lu_fid LU_OBF_FID;
00169 extern const struct lu_fid LU_LPF_FID;
00170 extern const struct lu_fid LU_DOT_LUSTRE_FID;
00171 extern const struct lu_fid LU_BACKEND_LPF_FID;

00173 enum {
00174         /*
00175          * This is how may metadata FIDs may be allocated in one sequence(128k)
00176          */
00177         LUSTRE_METADATA_SEQ_MAX_WIDTH = 0x0000000000020000ULL,
00178 
00179         /*
00180          * This is how many data FIDs could be allocated in one sequence(4B - 1)
00181          */
00182         LUSTRE_DATA_SEQ_MAX_WIDTH = 0x00000000FFFFFFFFULL,
00183 
00184         /*
00185          * How many sequences to allocate to a client at once.
00186          */
00187         LUSTRE_SEQ_META_WIDTH = 0x0000000000000001ULL,
00188 
00189         /*
00190          * seq allocation pool size.
00191          */
00192         LUSTRE_SEQ_BATCH_WIDTH = LUSTRE_SEQ_META_WIDTH * 1000,
00193 
00194         /*
00195          * This is how many sequences may be in one super-sequence allocated to
00196          * MDTs.
00197          */
00198         LUSTRE_SEQ_SUPER_WIDTH = ((1ULL << 30ULL) * LUSTRE_SEQ_META_WIDTH)
00199 };
00200 
00201 enum {
00203         OSD_OI_FID_OID_BITS     = 6,
00205         OSD_OI_FID_OID_BITS_MAX = 10,
00206 };
00207 
00209 enum local_oid {
00211         FLD_INDEX_OID           = 3UL,
00213         FID_SEQ_CTL_OID         = 4UL,
00214         FID_SEQ_SRV_OID         = 5UL,
00216         MDD_ROOT_INDEX_OID      = 6UL, /* deprecated in 2.4 */
00217         MDD_ORPHAN_OID          = 7UL, /* deprecated in 2.4 */
00218         MDD_LOV_OBJ_OID         = 8UL,
00219         MDD_CAPA_KEYS_OID       = 9UL,
00221         LAST_RECV_OID           = 11UL,
00222         OSD_FS_ROOT_OID         = 13UL,
00223         ACCT_USER_OID           = 15UL,
00224         ACCT_GROUP_OID          = 16UL,
00225         LFSCK_BOOKMARK_OID      = 17UL,
00226         OTABLE_IT_OID           = 18UL,
00227         OSD_LPF_OID             = 19UL,
00228         REPLY_DATA_OID          = 21UL,
00229         OFD_LAST_GROUP_OID      = 4117UL,
00230         LLOG_CATALOGS_OID       = 4118UL,
00231         MGS_CONFIGS_OID         = 4119UL,
00232         OFD_HEALTH_CHECK_OID    = 4120UL,
00233         MDD_LOV_OBJ_OSEQ        = 4121UL,
00234         LFSCK_NAMESPACE_OID     = 4122UL,
00235         REMOTE_PARENT_DIR_OID   = 4123UL,
00236         /* This definition is obsolete
00237          * SLAVE_LLOG_CATALOGS_OID      = 4124UL,
00238          */
00239         BATCHID_COMMITTED_OID   = 4125UL,
00240 };

00242 static inline void lu_local_obj_fid(struct lu_fid *fid, __u32 oid)
00243 {
00244         fid->f_seq = FID_SEQ_LOCAL_FILE;
00245         fid->f_oid = oid;
00246         fid->f_ver = 0;
00247 }
00248 
00249 static inline void lu_local_name_obj_fid(struct lu_fid *fid, __u32 oid)
00250 {
00251         fid->f_seq = FID_SEQ_LOCAL_NAME;
00252         fid->f_oid = oid;
00253         fid->f_ver = 0;
00254 }
00255 
00256 /* For new FS (>= 2.4), the root FID will be changed to
00257  * [FID_SEQ_ROOT:1:0], for existing FS, (upgraded to 2.4),
00258  * the root FID will still be IGIF */
00259 static inline int fid_is_root(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00260 {
00261         return unlikely((fid_seq(fid) == FID_SEQ_ROOT &&
00262                          fid_oid(fid) == FID_OID_ROOT));
00263 }
00264 
00265 static inline int fid_is_dot_lustre(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00266 {
00267         return unlikely(fid_seq(fid) == FID_SEQ_DOT_LUSTRE &&
00268                         fid_oid(fid) == FID_OID_DOT_LUSTRE);
00269 }
00270 
00271 static inline int fid_is_obf(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00272 {
00273         return unlikely(fid_seq(fid) == FID_SEQ_DOT_LUSTRE &&
00274                         fid_oid(fid) == FID_OID_DOT_LUSTRE_OBF);
00275 }
00276 
00277 static inline int fid_is_otable_it(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00278 {
00279         return unlikely(fid_seq(fid) == FID_SEQ_LOCAL_FILE &&
00280                         fid_oid(fid) == OTABLE_IT_OID);
00281 }
00282 
00283 static inline int fid_is_acct(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00284 {
00285         return fid_seq(fid) == FID_SEQ_LOCAL_FILE &&
00286                (fid_oid(fid) == ACCT_USER_OID ||
00287                 fid_oid(fid) == ACCT_GROUP_OID);
00288 }
00289 
00290 static inline int fid_is_quota(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00291 {
00292         return fid_seq(fid) == FID_SEQ_QUOTA ||
00293                fid_seq(fid) == FID_SEQ_QUOTA_GLB;
00294 }
00295 
00296 static inline int fid_is_name_llog(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00297 {
00298         return fid_seq(fid) == FID_SEQ_LLOG_NAME;
00299 }
00300 
00301 static inline int fid_is_namespace_visible(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00302 {
00303         const __u64 seq = fid_seq(fid);
00304 
00305         /* Here, we cannot distinguish whether the normal FID is for OST
00306          * object or not. It is caller's duty to check more if needed. */
00307         return (!fid_is_last_id(fid) &&
00308                 (fid_seq_is_norm(seq) || fid_seq_is_igif(seq))) ||
00309                fid_is_root(fid) || fid_seq_is_dot(seq);
00310 }
00311 
00312 static inline int fid_seq_in_fldb(__u64 seq)
00313 {
00314         return fid_seq_is_igif(seq) || fid_seq_is_norm(seq) ||
00315                fid_seq_is_root(seq) || fid_seq_is_dot(seq);
00316 }
00317 
00318 static inline void lu_last_id_fid(struct lu_fid *fid, __u64 seq, __u32 ost_idx)
00319 {
00320         if (fid_seq_is_mdt0(seq)) {
00321                 fid->f_seq = fid_idif_seq(0, ost_idx);
00322         } else {
00323                 LASSERTF(fid_seq_is_norm(seq) || fid_seq_is_echo(seq) ||
00324                          fid_seq_is_idif(seq), LPX64"\n", seq);
00325                 fid->f_seq = seq;
00326         }
00327         fid->f_oid = 0;
00328         fid->f_ver = 0;
00329 }
00330 
00331 static inline bool fid_is_md_operative(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00332 {
00333         return fid_is_mdt0(fid) || fid_is_igif(fid) ||
00334                fid_is_norm(fid) || fid_is_root(fid);
00335 }

00339         LUSTRE_SEQ_METADATA = 1,
00340         LUSTRE_SEQ_DATA
00341 };

00344         LUSTRE_SEQ_SERVER,
00345         LUSTRE_SEQ_CONTROLLER

00348 struct lu_server_seq;

00350 /* Client sequence manager interface. */
00351 struct lu_client_seq {
00352         /* Sequence-controller export. */
00353         struct obd_export      *lcs_exp;
00354         struct mutex            lcs_mutex;
00355 
00356         /*
00357          * Range of allowed for allocation sequeces. When using lu_client_seq on
00358          * clients, this contains meta-sequence range. And for servers this
00359          * contains super-sequence range.
00360          */
00361         struct lu_seq_range         lcs_space;
00362 
00363         /* Seq related proc */
00364         struct proc_dir_entry   *lcs_proc_dir;
00365 
00366         /* This holds last allocated fid in last obtained seq */
00367         struct lu_fid           lcs_fid;
00368 
00369         /* LUSTRE_SEQ_METADATA or LUSTRE_SEQ_DATA */
00370         enum lu_cli_type        lcs_type;
00371 
00372         /*
00373          * Service uuid, passed from MDT + seq name to form unique seq name to
00374          * use it with procfs.
00375          */
00376         char                    lcs_name[80];
00377 
00378         /*
00379          * Sequence width, that is how many objects may be allocated in one
00380          * sequence. Default value for it is LUSTRE_SEQ_MAX_WIDTH.
00381          */
00382         __u64                   lcs_width;
00383 
00384         /* Seq-server for direct talking */
00385         struct lu_server_seq   *lcs_srv;
00386 
00387         /* wait queue for fid allocation and update indicator */
00388         wait_queue_head_t       lcs_waitq;
00389         int                     lcs_update;
00390 };
00391 
00392 /* server sequence manager interface */
00393 struct lu_server_seq {
00394         /* Available sequences space */
00395         struct lu_seq_range         lss_space;
00396 
00397         /* keeps highwater in lsr_end for seq allocation algorithm */
00398         struct lu_seq_range         lss_lowater_set;
00399         struct lu_seq_range         lss_hiwater_set;
00400 
00401         /*
00402          * Device for server side seq manager needs (saving sequences to backing
00403          * store).
00404          */
00405         struct dt_device       *lss_dev;
00406 
00407         /* /seq file object device */
00408         struct dt_object       *lss_obj;
00409 
00410         /* Seq related proc */
00411         struct proc_dir_entry   *lss_proc_dir;
00412 
00413         /* LUSTRE_SEQ_SERVER or LUSTRE_SEQ_CONTROLLER */
00414         enum lu_mgr_type       lss_type;
00415 
00416         /* Client interface to request controller */
00417         struct lu_client_seq   *lss_cli;
00418 
00419         /* Mutex for protecting allocation */
00420         struct mutex            lss_mutex;
00421 
00422         /*
00423          * Service uuid, passed from MDT + seq name to form unique seq name to
00424          * use it with procfs.
00425          */
00426         char                    lss_name[80];
00427 
00428         /*
00429          * Allocation chunks for super and meta sequences. Default values are
00430          * LUSTRE_SEQ_SUPER_WIDTH and LUSTRE_SEQ_META_WIDTH.
00431          */
00432         __u64                   lss_width;
00433 
00434         /*
00435          * minimum lss_alloc_set size that should be allocated from
00436          * lss_space
00437          */
00438         __u64                   lss_set_width;
00439 
00440         /* sync is needed for update operation */
00441         __u32                   lss_need_sync;
00442 
00446         struct seq_server_site  *lss_site;
00447 };
00448

00454         u32                   ss_node_id;
00458         struct lu_server_fld *ss_server_fld;
00459         struct lu_client_fld *ss_client_fld;
00460 
00464         struct lu_server_seq *ss_server_seq;
00465 
00469         struct lu_server_seq *ss_control_seq;
00470         struct obd_export    *ss_control_exp;
00471 
00475         struct lu_client_seq *ss_client_seq;
00476 };

00529 /* fid locking */
00530 
00531 struct ldlm_namespace;
00532 
00533 /*
00534  * Build (DLM) resource name from FID.
00535  *
00536  * NOTE: until Lustre 1.8.7/2.1.1 the fid_ver() was packed into name[2],
00537  * but was moved into name[1] along with the OID to avoid consuming the
00538  * renaming name[2,3] fields that need to be used for the quota identifier.
00539  */
00540 static inline void
00541 fid_build_reg_res_name(const struct lu_fid *fid, struct ldlm_res_id *res)
00542 {
00543         memset(res, 0, sizeof(*res));
00544         res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_SEQ_OFF] = fid_seq(fid);
00545         res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_VER_OID_OFF] = fid_ver_oid(fid);
00546 }
00547 
00548 /*
00549  * Return true if resource is for object identified by FID.
00550  */
00551 static inline int fid_res_name_eq(const struct lu_fid *fid,
00552                                   const struct ldlm_res_id *res)
00553 {
00554         return res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_SEQ_OFF] == fid_seq(fid) &&
00555                res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_VER_OID_OFF] == fid_ver_oid(fid);
00556 }
00557 
00558 /*
00559  * Extract FID from LDLM resource. Reverse of fid_build_reg_res_name().
00560  */
00561 static inline void
00562 fid_extract_from_res_name(struct lu_fid *fid, const struct ldlm_res_id *res)
00563 {
00564         fid->f_seq = res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_SEQ_OFF];
00565         fid->f_oid = (__u32)(res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_VER_OID_OFF]);
00566         fid->f_ver = (__u32)(res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_VER_OID_OFF] >> 32);
00567         LASSERT(fid_res_name_eq(fid, res));
00568 }
00569 
00570 /*
00571  * Build (DLM) resource identifier from global quota FID and quota ID.
00572  */
00573 static inline void
00574 fid_build_quota_res_name(const struct lu_fid *glb_fid, union lquota_id *qid,
00575                       struct ldlm_res_id *res)
00576 {
00577         fid_build_reg_res_name(glb_fid, res);
00578         res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_QUOTA_SEQ_OFF] = fid_seq(&qid->qid_fid);
00579         res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_QUOTA_VER_OID_OFF] = fid_ver_oid(&qid->qid_fid);
00580 }
00581 
00582 /*
00583  * Extract global FID and quota ID from resource name
00584  */
00585 static inline void fid_extract_from_quota_res(struct lu_fid *glb_fid,
00586                                               union lquota_id *qid,
00587                                               const struct ldlm_res_id *res)
00588 {
00589         fid_extract_from_res_name(glb_fid, res);
00590         qid->qid_fid.f_seq = res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_QUOTA_SEQ_OFF];
00591         qid->qid_fid.f_oid = (__u32)res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_QUOTA_VER_OID_OFF];
00592         qid->qid_fid.f_ver =
00593                 (__u32)(res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_QUOTA_VER_OID_OFF] >> 32);
00594 }
00595 
00596 static inline void
00597 fid_build_pdo_res_name(const struct lu_fid *fid, unsigned int hash,
00598                        struct ldlm_res_id *res)
00599 {
00600         fid_build_reg_res_name(fid, res);
00601         res->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_HSH_OFF] = hash;
00602 }
00603 
00622 static inline void ostid_build_res_name(const struct ost_id *oi,
00623                                         struct ldlm_res_id *name)
00624 {
00625         memset(name, 0, sizeof *name);
00626         if (fid_seq_is_mdt0(ostid_seq(oi))) {
00627                 name->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_SEQ_OFF] = ostid_id(oi);
00628                 name->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_VER_OID_OFF] = ostid_seq(oi);
00629         } else {
00630                 fid_build_reg_res_name(&oi->oi_fid, name);
00631         }
00632 }
00633 
00637 static inline bool ostid_res_name_eq(const struct ost_id *oi,
00638                                      const struct ldlm_res_id *name)
00639 {
00640         /* Note: it is just a trick here to save some effort, probably the
00641          * correct way would be turn them into the FID and compare */
00642         if (fid_seq_is_mdt0(ostid_seq(oi))) {
00643                 return name->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_SEQ_OFF] == ostid_id(oi) &&
00644                        name->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_VER_OID_OFF] == ostid_seq(oi);
00645         } else {
00646                 return name->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_SEQ_OFF] == ostid_seq(oi) &&
00647                        name->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_VER_OID_OFF] == ostid_id(oi);
00648         }
00649 }
00650 
00651 /* The same as osc_build_res_name() */
00652 static inline void ost_fid_build_resid(const struct lu_fid *fid,
00653                                        struct ldlm_res_id *resname)
00654 {
00655         if (fid_is_mdt0(fid) || fid_is_idif(fid)) {
00656                 struct ost_id oi;
00657                 oi.oi.oi_id = 0; /* gcc 4.7.2 complains otherwise */
00658                 if (fid_to_ostid(fid, &oi) != 0)
00659                         return;
00660                 ostid_build_res_name(&oi, resname);
00661         } else {
00662                 fid_build_reg_res_name(fid, resname);
00663         }
00664 }
00665 
00666 static inline void ost_fid_from_resid(struct lu_fid *fid,
00667                                       const struct ldlm_res_id *name,
00668                                       int ost_idx)
00669 {
00670         if (fid_seq_is_mdt0(name->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_VER_OID_OFF])) {
00671                 /* old resid */
00672                 struct ost_id oi;
00673                 ostid_set_seq(&oi, name->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_VER_OID_OFF]);
00674                 ostid_set_id(&oi, name->name[LUSTRE_RES_ID_SEQ_OFF]);
00675                 ostid_to_fid(fid, &oi, ost_idx);
00676         } else {
00677                 /* new resid */
00678                 fid_extract_from_res_name(fid, name);
00679         }
00680 }
00681 
00693 static inline __u64 fid_flatten(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00694 {
00695         __u64 ino;
00696         __u64 seq;
00697 
00698         if (fid_is_igif(fid)) {
00699                 ino = lu_igif_ino(fid);
00700                 RETURN(ino);
00701         }
00702 
00703         seq = fid_seq(fid);
00704 
00705         ino = (seq << 24) + ((seq >> 24) & 0xffffff0000ULL) + fid_oid(fid);
00706 
00707         RETURN(ino ? ino : fid_oid(fid));
00708 }
00709 
00710 static inline __u32 fid_hash(const struct lu_fid *f, int bits)
00711 {
00712         /* all objects with same id and different versions will belong to same
00713          * collisions list. */
00714         return hash_long(fid_flatten(f), bits);
00715 }
00716 
00719 static inline __u32 fid_flatten32(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00720 {
00721         __u32 ino;
00722         __u64 seq;
00723 
00724         if (fid_is_igif(fid)) {
00725                 ino = lu_igif_ino(fid);
00726                 RETURN(ino);
00727         }
00728 
00729         seq = fid_seq(fid) - FID_SEQ_START;
00730 
00731         /* Map the high bits of the OID into higher bits of the inode number so
00732          * that inodes generated at about the same time have a reduced chance
00733          * of collisions. This will give a period of 2^12 = 1024 unique clients
00734          * (from SEQ) and up to min(LUSTRE_SEQ_MAX_WIDTH, 2^20) = 128k objects
00735          * (from OID), or up to 128M inodes without collisions for new files. */
00736         ino = ((seq & 0x000fffffULL) << 12) + ((seq >> 8) & 0xfffff000) +
00737                (seq >> (64 - (40-8)) & 0xffffff00) +
00738                (fid_oid(fid) & 0xff000fff) + ((fid_oid(fid) & 0x00fff000) << 8);
00739 
00740         RETURN(ino ? ino : fid_oid(fid));
00741 }
00742 
00743 static inline int
00744 lu_fid_diff(const struct lu_fid *fid1, const struct lu_fid *fid2)
00745 {
00746         LASSERTF(fid_seq(fid1) == fid_seq(fid2), "fid1:"DFID", fid2:"DFID"\n",
00747                  PFID(fid1), PFID(fid2));
00748 
00749         if (fid_is_idif(fid1) && fid_is_idif(fid2))
00750                 return fid_idif_id(fid1->f_seq, fid1->f_oid, fid1->f_ver) -
00751                        fid_idif_id(fid2->f_seq, fid2->f_oid, fid2->f_ver);
00752 
00753         return fid_oid(fid1) - fid_oid(fid2);
00754 }
00755 
00756 #define LUSTRE_SEQ_SRV_NAME "seq_srv"
00757 #define LUSTRE_SEQ_CTL_NAME "seq_ctl"
00758 
00759 /* Range common stuff */
00760 static inline void
00761 range_cpu_to_le(struct lu_seq_range *dst, const struct lu_seq_range *src)
00762 {
00763         dst->lsr_start = cpu_to_le64(src->lsr_start);
00764         dst->lsr_end = cpu_to_le64(src->lsr_end);
00765         dst->lsr_index = cpu_to_le32(src->lsr_index);
00766         dst->lsr_flags = cpu_to_le32(src->lsr_flags);
00767 }
00768 
00769 static inline void
00770 range_le_to_cpu(struct lu_seq_range *dst, const struct lu_seq_range *src)
00771 {
00772         dst->lsr_start = le64_to_cpu(src->lsr_start);
00773         dst->lsr_end = le64_to_cpu(src->lsr_end);
00774         dst->lsr_index = le32_to_cpu(src->lsr_index);
00775         dst->lsr_flags = le32_to_cpu(src->lsr_flags);
00776 }
00777 
00778 static inline void
00779 range_cpu_to_be(struct lu_seq_range *dst, const struct lu_seq_range *src)
00780 {
00781         dst->lsr_start = cpu_to_be64(src->lsr_start);
00782         dst->lsr_end = cpu_to_be64(src->lsr_end);
00783         dst->lsr_index = cpu_to_be32(src->lsr_index);
00784         dst->lsr_flags = cpu_to_be32(src->lsr_flags);
00785 }
00786 
00787 static inline void
00788 range_be_to_cpu(struct lu_seq_range *dst, const struct lu_seq_range *src)
00789 {
00790         dst->lsr_start = be64_to_cpu(src->lsr_start);
00791         dst->lsr_end = be64_to_cpu(src->lsr_end);
00792         dst->lsr_index = be32_to_cpu(src->lsr_index);
00793         dst->lsr_flags = be32_to_cpu(src->lsr_flags);
00794 }
00795 
00796 static inline void range_array_cpu_to_le(struct lu_seq_range_array *dst,
00797                                          const struct lu_seq_range_array *src)
00798 {
00799         __u32 i;
00800 
00801         for (i = 0; i < src->lsra_count; i++)
00802                 range_cpu_to_le(&dst->lsra_lsr[i], &src->lsra_lsr[i]);
00803 
00804         dst->lsra_count = cpu_to_le32(src->lsra_count);
00805 }
00806 
00807 static inline void range_array_le_to_cpu(struct lu_seq_range_array *dst,
00808                                          const struct lu_seq_range_array *src)
00809 {
00810         __u32 i;
00811 
00812         dst->lsra_count = le32_to_cpu(src->lsra_count);
00813         for (i = 0; i < dst->lsra_count; i++)
00814                 range_le_to_cpu(&dst->lsra_lsr[i], &src->lsra_lsr[i]);
00815 }
